<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 14.3 is: Controlling expressions shall not be invariant.
Here are exceptions to this rule:
1. Invariants that are used to create infinite loops are permitted.
2. A do-while loop with an essentially Boolean controlling expression that evaluates to false and satisfies the constraints and semantics for an integer constant expression is permitted.
</misra_rule>

<target_code>
Here is the code of metal_condition_wait:
```c
int metal_condition_wait(struct metal_condition *cv,
				       metal_mutex_t *m)
{
	uintptr_t tmpmptr = 0, mptr = (uintptr_t)m;
	int v = 0;

	/* Check if the mutex has been acquired */
	if (!cv || !m || !metal_mutex_is_acquired(m))
		return -EINVAL;

	if (!atomic_compare_exchange_strong(&cv->mptr, &tmpmptr, mptr)) {
		if (tmpmptr != mptr)
			return -EINVAL;
	}

	v = atomic_load(&cv->wakeups);
	atomic_fetch_add(&cv->waiters, 1);

	/* Release the mutex before sleeping. */
	metal_mutex_release(m);
	syscall(SYS_futex, &cv->wakeups, FUTEX_WAIT, v, NULL, NULL, 0);
	atomic_fetch_sub(&cv->waiters, 1);
	/* Acquire the mutex after it's waken up. */
	metal_mutex_acquire(m);

	return 0;
}
```
</target_code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation:
No controlling expressions in this function are invariant at compile time. Specifically:
- The initial guard if (!cv || !m || !metal_mutex_is_acquired(m)) depends on pointer parameters and the runtime result of metal_mutex_is_acquired(), so it is not invariant.
- The if (!atomic_compare_exchange_strong(&cv->mptr, &tmpmptr, mptr)) depends on the atomic variable cv->mptr and the outcome of an atomic operation; its result is runtime-dependent and not invariant. The nested if (tmpmptr != mptr) compares tmpmptr (modified by the atomic operation) and mptr, so it is also runtime-dependent.
- There are no loop constructs (for, while, do-while) in this function; hence the allowed exceptions for infinite loops or do-while constant false are not relevant.
- Other statements (atomic_load/atomic_fetch_add/atomic_fetch_sub, system call syscall(SYS_futex,...), mutex release/acquire) are not controlling expressions.

Therefore there are no code fragments in this function that should be investigated for MISRA C 2023 Rule 14.3 (controlling expressions shall not be invariant).
